Instance.description: Tuning to define each individual venue. This class an event schedule tuning, which is a mapping of situation to schedule for that situation. When the scheduled time occurs, the situation that occurs at that time will spin up.

Tunable.name: allow_game_triggered_events
Tunable.description: Whether this venue can have game triggered events. ex for careers

Tunable.name: allow_rolestate_routing_on_navmesh
Tunable.description: Allow all RoleStates routing permission on lot navmeshes of this venue type. This is particularly useful for outdoor venue types (lots with no walls), where it is awkward to have to 'invite a sim in' before they may route on the lot, be called over, etc. This tunable overrides the 'Allow Npc Routing On Active Lot' tunable of individual RoleStates.

Tunable.name: allow_super_speed_three
Tunable.description: If set to True, game is allowed to get into super speed 3.

Tunable.name: allowed_for_clubs
Tunable.description: If checked, this Venue can be associated with Clubs and will be available for Club Gatherings.

Tunable.name: allows_fire
Tunable.description: If True a fire can happen on this venue, otherwise fires will not spawn on this venue.

TunableList.name: automatic_objects
TunableList.description: A list of objects that is required to exist on this venue (e.g. the mailbox). If any of these objects are missing from this venue, they will be auto-placed on zone load.

TunableTuple.description: An item that is required to be present on this venue. The object's tag will be used to determine if any similar objects are present. If no similar objects are present, then the object's actual definition is used to create an object of this type. This is not the same as required objects tuning. Please read comments for both the fields. E.g. To require a mailbox to be present on a lot, tune a hypothetical basicMailbox here. The code will not trigger as long as a basicMailbox, fancyMailbox, or cheapMailbox are present on the lot. If none of them are, then a basicMailbox will be automatically created.

Tunable.name: default_value
Tunable.description: The default object to use if no suitably tagged object is present on the lot.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: The tag to search for

TunableTuple.name: background_event_schedule
TunableTuple.description: The Background Events that run on this venue. They run underneath any user facing Situations and there can only be one at a time. The schedule times and durations are windows in which background events can start.

TunableList.name: schedule_entries
TunableList.description: A list of event schedules. Each event is a mapping of days of the week to a start_time and duration.

TunableTuple.description: A schedule. Define availability for days of the week. For the set of specified days, define an hour of the day and a duration, in hours. Optionally, specified if the start time is random within the tuned window.

TunableTuple.name: days_available
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

Tunable.name: duration
Tunable.description: Duration of this work session in hours.

TunableVariant.name: multi_day_career_days_at_work
TunableVariant.display: Multi Day Career Days At Work
TunableVariant.description: This tunable should only be used with multi-day rabbitholes. If you are not sure about whether this should be used for the career you are tuning, please check with your GPE partner. Set the days the Sim should be at their multi-day career here. Used for setting values in UI.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableVariant.name: multi_day_career_start_and_end_days
TunableVariant.display: Multi Day Career Start And End Days
TunableVariant.description: This tunable should only be used with multi-day rabbitholes. If you are not sure about whether this should be used for the career you are tuning, please check with your GPE partner. Used to tell the UI which days the multi-day career starts and ends on.

TunableEnum.name: end_day
TunableEnum.description: The day the multi-day career ends.

TunableEnum.name: start_day
TunableEnum.description: The day the multi-day career starts.

Tunable.name: random_start
Tunable.description: If checked, this schedule will have a random start time in the tuned window each time.

TunableEnum.name: schedule_shift_type
TunableEnum.description: Shift Type for the schedule, this will be used for validations.

Tunable.name: situation
Tunable.description: The situation to start according to the tuned schedule.

TunableTuple.name: start_time
TunableTuple.description: An Hour(24Hr) and Minute representing a time relative to the beginning of a day.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

TunableList.name: category_tags
TunableList.description: A list of tags to associate with this venue type.

TunableEnum.description: A category tag for this venue.

TunableVariant.name: club_gathering_auto_spawn_schedule
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this schedule will specify the times when we will attempt to spawn associated Club Gatherings on this venue.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: This schedule will specify the times when we will attempt to spawn associated Club Gatherings on this venue.

TunableList.name: schedule_entries
TunableList.description: A list of event schedules. Each event is a mapping of days of the week to a start_time and duration.

TunableTuple.description: A schedule. Define availability for days of the week. For the set of specified days, define an hour of the day and a duration, in hours. Optionally, specified if the start time is random within the tuned window.

TunableTuple.name: club_gathering_data
TunableTuple.description: Specify gathering behavior at these days and time.

TunableList.name: ideal_club_gatherings
TunableList.description: Define the ideal number of gatherings that should be auto-started.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: maximum_club_gatherings
Tunable.description: Define the maximum number of gatherings that can be auto- started.

TunableTuple.name: days_available
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

Tunable.name: duration
Tunable.description: Duration of this work session in hours.

TunableVariant.name: multi_day_career_days_at_work
TunableVariant.display: Multi Day Career Days At Work
TunableVariant.description: This tunable should only be used with multi-day rabbitholes. If you are not sure about whether this should be used for the career you are tuning, please check with your GPE partner. Set the days the Sim should be at their multi-day career here. Used for setting values in UI.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableVariant.name: multi_day_career_start_and_end_days
TunableVariant.display: Multi Day Career Start And End Days
TunableVariant.description: This tunable should only be used with multi-day rabbitholes. If you are not sure about whether this should be used for the career you are tuning, please check with your GPE partner. Used to tell the UI which days the multi-day career starts and ends on.

TunableEnum.name: end_day
TunableEnum.description: The day the multi-day career ends.

TunableEnum.name: start_day
TunableEnum.description: The day the multi-day career starts.

Tunable.name: random_start
Tunable.description: If checked, this schedule will have a random start time in the tuned window each time.

TunableEnum.name: schedule_shift_type
TunableEnum.description: Shift Type for the schedule, this will be used for validations.

TunableTuple.name: start_time
TunableTuple.description: An Hour(24Hr) and Minute representing a time relative to the beginning of a day.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

TunableVariant.name: club_gathering_text
TunableVariant.description: Specify text included in an NPC's invite to join a gathering at this venue. This must be enabled if allowed_for_clubs is checked. If allowed_for_clubs is unchecked, setting this field has no effect.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: A localization string. This may either be a single string, a set to pick a random string from, or concatenation from list of string.

TunableTuple.name: concatenation
TunableTuple.description: A list of localized string concatenations. These strings will be joined together into single line-separated string

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: single
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: variation
TunableTuple.description: A list of possible localized string variations.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: display_name
Tunable.description: Name that will be displayed for the venue

Tunable.name: display_name_incomplete
Tunable.description: Name that will be displayed for the incomplete venue

Tunable.name: display_name_with_tier
Tunable.description: Name that will be displayed in contexts where we also want to show the current venue tier. If this venue has no venue tiers, this name will be ignored and display_name will be used.

TunableList.name: display_venue_features
TunableList.description: Features to be displayed on this venue's build buy configuration panel. Currently this has no gameplay effect, only for UI purpose.

Tunable.name: venue_feature_description
Tunable.description: Description of the venue feature.

Tunable.name: venue_feature_icon
Tunable.description: Icon of the venue feature.

Tunable.name: venue_feature_name
Tunable.description: Name of the venue feature.

TunableList.name: drama_node_events
TunableList.description: A list of drama nodes that provide special events to the venues that they are a part of.

Tunable.description: A drama node that will contain a special even on a venue.

Tunable.name: drama_node_events_to_schedule
Tunable.description: The number of drama node events that will be scheduled if events are specified.

Tunable.name: exclude_owned_objects_in_lot_value_calculation
Tunable.display: Exclude Owned Objects In Lot Value Calculation
Tunable.description: Whether or not owned objects should be excluded when computing the lot value for this venue type. Example: Residential should include the value but Rentable should not.

TunableList.name: forbidden_objects
TunableList.description: A list of objects that are not allowed on the lot. If they are placed, the lot cannot be labeled as this venue.

TunableTuple.description: Specify object tag(s) that can't be on this venue. Allows you to group objects, i.e. weight bench, treadmill, and basketball goals are tagged as 'exercise objects.' This is not the same as automatic objects tuning. Please read comments for both the fields.

Tunable.name: is_optional
Tunable.description: If True, this object requirement will be optional to this venue. E.g. Waiter station and host station for restaurant should set this entry to True.

Tunable.name: is_unit_specific
Tunable.description: If True, this object requirement will be specific to individual units of a multi unit venue.

Tunable.name: max_number
Tunable.description: The upper bound below which the number of objects of this type on the lot must be.

Tunable.name: min_number
Tunable.description: The lower bound above which the number of objects of this type on the lot must be.

TunableTuple.name: object
TunableTuple.description: Specify object tag(s) that must be on this venue. Allows you to group objects, i.e. weight bench, treadmill, and basketball goals are tagged as 'exercise objects.'

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tags of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: object_display_name
Tunable.description: Name that will be displayed for the object(s)

TunableEnum.name: object_flags
TunableEnum.description: Optional flags for this venue object. E.g. When there is a small business registered in that lot.

TunableList.name: object_parent_pair_tests
TunableList.description: Specify object tag(s) and/or parent attachment tags that requires to be on this venue. Allows you to group objects, i.e. weight bench, treadmill, and basketball goals are tagged as 'exercise objects.'

Tunable.name: count
Tunable.description: How many required objects will be satisfied with this object(and/or with parent pair). E.g. a chair that slots to table will count as one dining spot, but booth slot to table will count as 2.

TunableTuple.name: object_tags
TunableTuple.description: The objects (tag) that would count for the required items.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tags of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableTuple.name: parent_tags
TunableTuple.description: If set, the object tuned in object_tags would required to be slotted to the parent object tuned in parent_tags. E.g. in restaurant, a chair (with restaurant_chair tag) would need to slot to a table (with restaurant_table_tag) to count as a dining slot. But since bar will not has the restaurant_table_tag, so a high chair that slots to the bar will not count as dining spot.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tags of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableEnum.name: object_test_type
TunableEnum.description: This option determines what test will be applied. To test the number of objects of a certain type, select OBJECT. To test for a pool, select pool. To test the number of tiles used by the home, select tile (tiny home venues do this).

Tunable.name: tooltip_override
Tunable.description: If tuned, the tooltip that will be shown when this requirement is moused over in the venue configuration requirements UI.

Tunable.name: gallery_upload_venue_type
Tunable.description: The venue type that this venue gets uploaded as to the gallery. In each region's tuning, make sure the upload type is downloaded as the appropriate venue type. Example: Rentable venues should be uploaded as Residential.

Tunable.name: hide_from_buildbuy_ui
Tunable.description: If True, this venue type will not be available in the venue picker in build/buy.

TunableList.name: included_venues_for_club_gathering
TunableList.description: Venue types that will also be considered valid for club gatherings for a club with this venue type as its club hangout.

Tunable.description: Venue type to be included for club gatherings.

Tunable.name: new_venue_type_button_headline_text
Tunable.display: New Venue Type Button Headline Text
Tunable.description: When the venue type is 'new' to the player, the Venue Celebration dialog is shown. This is the localized string ID for the text that appears just above the messages, but below the image. If nothing is tuned it will show the default string as specified in ui code. Unless there are buttons tuned, then it will be hidden.

TunableList.name: new_venue_type_buttons
TunableList.description: A list of button data to be used to create buttons on the New Venue Dialog. If nothing is tuned here then we will default to the original format of the dialog which contains just the single button.

TunableTuple.description: Tuning data for buttons to show when this dialog pops up. Consists of the text to show as the button text as well as the UiMessage to send (along with parameters) when the button is clicked.

Tunable.name: button_string
Tunable.description: The string to be displayed as button text.

TunableTuple.name: ui_message
TunableTuple.description: The UI message to send when the button is clicked along with any parameters needed.

Tunable.name: message_name
Tunable.description: Name of the UI message. e.g. 'ShowEscapeMenu'

TunableList.name: parameters
TunableList.description: Any parameters to send with the message. Consult your UI engineering partner to determine what parameters, if any, should be specified.

TunableVariant.name: value
TunableVariant.description: Value to associate with this parameter.

Tunable.name: raw_bool
Tunable.description: Provide a boolean value.

Tunable.name: raw_float
Tunable.description: Provide a floating-point value.

Tunable.name: raw_int
Tunable.description: Provide an integer value.

Tunable.name: raw_string
Tunable.description: Provide a non-localized string.

Tunable.name: resource_key
Tunable.description: Provide a resource key. This is provided to the UI in the same format as the ResourceKey AS3 class.

Tunable.name: new_venue_type_dialog_description
Tunable.description: When the venue type is 'new' to the player, the Venue Celebration dialog is shown. This is the localized string ID for the description text.

Tunable.name: new_venue_type_dialog_example_item
Tunable.display: New Venue Type Dialog Example Item
Tunable.description: When the venue type is 'new' to the player, the Venue Celebration dialog is shown. This is the example lot ID to apply should the user respond positively to the dialog.

Tunable.name: new_venue_type_dialog_image
Tunable.description: When the venue type is 'new' to the player, the Venue Celebration dialog is shown. This is the main image ID shown in the dialog.

Tunable.name: new_venue_type_headline_text
Tunable.description: When the venue type is 'new' to the player, the Venue Celebration dialog is shown. This is the localized string ID for the headline text. If nothing is tuned it will show the default string as specified in ui code. {0.String} will get you the name of the venue for the string.

TunableList.name: npc_summoning_behavior
TunableList.description: Whenever an NPC is summoned to a lot by the player, determine which action to take based on the summoning purpose. The purpose is a dynamic enum: venues.venue_constants.NPCSummoningPurpose. The action will generally involve either adding a sim to an existing situation or creating a situation then adding them to it. \depot\Sims4Projects\Docs\Design\Open Streets\Open Street Invite Matrix.xlsx residential: This is behavior pushed on the NPC if this venue was a residential lot. create_situation: Place the NPC in the specified situation/job pair. add_to_background_situation: Add the NPC the currently running background situation in the venue. notify_zone_director: notifies the current zones zone director that a sim needs to be spawned and lets the zone director handle it.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The different reasons that we have for summoning an NPC. Every time an NPC is summoned they are given one of these reasons as a key to how we want to handle that Sim.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A mapping between species and the action we want to take. If a species doesn't have specific tuning then the Human species tuning will be used instead.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The species that we want to use to perform this behavior.

TunableVariant.name: value
TunableVariant.description: The behavior that we want to accomplish based on the summoning type.

TunableTuple.name: add_to_background_situation
TunableTuple.description: Add the sims to the venue's current background situation.

TunableTuple.name: create_situation
TunableTuple.description: Create a new situation of this type and add the NPC to its tuned job.

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: The situation job to assign the sim to. If set to None the sim will be assigned to the situation's default job.

TunableTuple.name: notify_zone_director
TunableTuple.description: Notifies the current zone director that a Sim needs to be spawned and lets the zone director handle it.

TunableTuple.name: residential
TunableTuple.description: NPC behavior on a residential lot. The behavior is different depending on the lot belonging to the player versus NPC. Greeted behavior can modify behavior as well.

TunableTuple.name: npc_lot_greeted
TunableTuple.description: Create a new situation of this type and add the NPC to its tuned job.

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: The situation job to assign the sim to. If set to None the sim will be assigned to the situation's default job.

TunableTuple.name: npc_lot_ungreeted
TunableTuple.description: Create a new situation of this type and add the NPC to its tuned job.

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: The situation job to assign the sim to. If set to None the sim will be assigned to the situation's default job.

TunableTuple.name: player_sim_lot
TunableTuple.description: Create a new situation of this type and add the NPC to its tuned job.

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: The situation job to assign the sim to. If set to None the sim will be assigned to the situation's default job.

TunableVariant.name: player_requires_visitation_rights
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, then lots of this venue type will require player Sims that are not on their home lot to go through the process of being greeted before they are given full rights to using the lot.

Tunable.name: greeted
Tunable.description: The situation to create for greeted player sims on this lot.

Tunable.name: ungreeted
Tunable.description: The situation to create for ungreeted player sims on this lot.

TunableList.name: required_objects
TunableList.description: A list of objects that are required to be on a lot before that lot can be labeled as this venue.

TunableTuple.description: Specify object tag(s) that must be on this venue. Allows you to group objects, i.e. weight bench, treadmill, and basketball goals are tagged as 'exercise objects.' This is not the same as automatic objects tuning. Please read comments for both the fields.

Tunable.name: is_optional
Tunable.description: If True, this object requirement will be optional to this venue. E.g. Waiter station and host station for restaurant should set this entry to True.

Tunable.name: is_unit_specific
Tunable.description: If True, this object requirement will be specific to individual units of a multi unit venue.

Tunable.name: max_number
Tunable.description: The upper bound below which the number of objects of this type on the lot must be.

Tunable.name: min_number
Tunable.description: The lower bound above which the number of objects of this type on the lot must be.

TunableTuple.name: object
TunableTuple.description: Specify object tag(s) that must be on this venue. Allows you to group objects, i.e. weight bench, treadmill, and basketball goals are tagged as 'exercise objects.'

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tags of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: object_display_name
Tunable.description: Name that will be displayed for the object(s)

TunableEnum.name: object_flags
TunableEnum.description: Optional flags for this venue object. E.g. When there is a small business registered in that lot.

TunableList.name: object_parent_pair_tests
TunableList.description: Specify object tag(s) and/or parent attachment tags that requires to be on this venue. Allows you to group objects, i.e. weight bench, treadmill, and basketball goals are tagged as 'exercise objects.'

Tunable.name: count
Tunable.description: How many required objects will be satisfied with this object(and/or with parent pair). E.g. a chair that slots to table will count as one dining spot, but booth slot to table will count as 2.

TunableTuple.name: object_tags
TunableTuple.description: The objects (tag) that would count for the required items.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tags of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableTuple.name: parent_tags
TunableTuple.description: If set, the object tuned in object_tags would required to be slotted to the parent object tuned in parent_tags. E.g. in restaurant, a chair (with restaurant_chair tag) would need to slot to a table (with restaurant_table_tag) to count as a dining slot. But since bar will not has the restaurant_table_tag, so a high chair that slots to the bar will not count as dining spot.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tags of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableEnum.name: object_test_type
TunableEnum.description: This option determines what test will be applied. To test the number of objects of a certain type, select OBJECT. To test for a pool, select pool. To test the number of tiles used by the home, select tile (tiny home venues do this).

Tunable.name: tooltip_override
Tunable.description: If tuned, the tooltip that will be shown when this requirement is moused over in the venue configuration requirements UI.

TunableVariant.name: small_business_seed
TunableVariant.description: When venue is purchased, if user selects to auto create business, it will use this reference to create that small business.

TunableTuple.name: special_event_schedule
TunableTuple.description: The Special Events that run on this venue. These run on top of Background Events. We run only one user facing event at a time, so if the player started something then this may run in the background, otherwise the player will be invited to join in on this Venue Special Event.

TunableList.name: schedule_entries
TunableList.description: A list of event schedules. Each event is a mapping of days of the week to a start_time and duration.

TunableTuple.description: A schedule. Define availability for days of the week. For the set of specified days, define an hour of the day and a duration, in hours. Optionally, specified if the start time is random within the tuned window.

TunableTuple.name: days_available
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

Tunable.name: duration
Tunable.description: Duration of this work session in hours.

TunableVariant.name: multi_day_career_days_at_work
TunableVariant.display: Multi Day Career Days At Work
TunableVariant.description: This tunable should only be used with multi-day rabbitholes. If you are not sure about whether this should be used for the career you are tuning, please check with your GPE partner. Set the days the Sim should be at their multi-day career here. Used for setting values in UI.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableVariant.name: multi_day_career_start_and_end_days
TunableVariant.display: Multi Day Career Start And End Days
TunableVariant.description: This tunable should only be used with multi-day rabbitholes. If you are not sure about whether this should be used for the career you are tuning, please check with your GPE partner. Used to tell the UI which days the multi-day career starts and ends on.

TunableEnum.name: end_day
TunableEnum.description: The day the multi-day career ends.

TunableEnum.name: start_day
TunableEnum.description: The day the multi-day career starts.

Tunable.name: random_start
Tunable.description: If checked, this schedule will have a random start time in the tuned window each time.

TunableEnum.name: schedule_shift_type
TunableEnum.description: Shift Type for the schedule, this will be used for validations.

Tunable.name: situation
Tunable.description: The situation to start according to the tuned schedule.

TunableTuple.name: start_time
TunableTuple.description: An Hour(24Hr) and Minute representing a time relative to the beginning of a day.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

Tunable.name: store_travel_group_placed_objects
Tunable.description: If checked, any placed objects while in a travel group will be returned to household inventory once travel group is disbanded.

Tunable.name: supports_welcome_wagon
Tunable.description: Whether or not welcome wagons will appear on this venue type.

Tunable.name: tier_banner_max_fail_text
Tunable.description: If tuned, a message that will be displayed in the tier banner if the venue fails to satisfy the lowest tier due to being over the maximum for that tier requirement.

Tunable.name: tier_banner_min_fail_text
Tunable.description: If tuned, a message that will be displayed in the tier banner if the venue fails to satisfy the lowest tier due to being under the minimum for that tier requirement.

TunableVariant.name: travel_group_limit
TunableVariant.description: Maximum number of travel groups allowed in this venue.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The maximum number of travel groups allowed in this venue.

TunableVariant.name: travel_interaction_name
TunableVariant.description: Specify what name a travel interaction gets when this Venue is an adjacent lot.

TunableTuple.name: visit_residential
TunableTuple.description: The interaction name for when the destination lot is a residence.

Tunable.name: go_here_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when no household lives on the destination lot. Tokens: 0:ActorSim Example: 'Go Here'

Tunable.name: go_home_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when the actor's home lot is the destination lot. Tokens: 0:ActorSim Example: 'Go Home'

Tunable.name: no_one_home_encapsulation
Tunable.description: The string that gets appended on the end of our interaction string if none of the household Sims at the destination lot are home. Tokens: 0:Interaction Name Example: '{0.String} (No One At Home)'

Tunable.name: ring_doorbell_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when the actor doesn't know any Sims that live on the destination lot. Tokens: 0:ActorSim Example: 'Ring Doorbell'

Tunable.name: visit_household_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when the actor knows more than one Sim that lives on the destination lot, or the Sim they know is not at home. Tokens: 0:ActorSim, 1:Household Name Example: 'Visit The {1.String} Household'

Tunable.name: visit_sim_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when the actor knows exactly one Sim that lives on the destination lot. Tokens: 0:ActorSim, 1:Sim known Example: 'Visit {1.SimName}'

Tunable.name: visit_the_household_plural_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when the actor knows more than one Sim that lives on the destination lot, or the Sim they know is not at home, and everyone who lives there has the same household name as their last name. Tokens: 0:ActorSim, 1:Household Name Example: 'Visit The {1.String|enHouseholdNamePlural}'

TunableTuple.name: visit_venue
TunableTuple.description: The interaction name for when the destination lot is a commercial venue. Example: 'Visit The Bar'

Tunable.name: visit_venue_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when the actor visit this venue Tokens: 0:ActorSim

TunableVariant.name: travel_with_interaction_name
TunableVariant.description: Specify what name a travel interaction gets when this Venue is an adjacent lot.

TunableTuple.name: visit_residential
TunableTuple.description: The interaction name for when the destination lot is a residence and the actor Sim is traveling with someone.

Tunable.name: go_here_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when no household lives on the destination lot. Tokens: 0:ActorSim Example: 'Go Here'

Tunable.name: go_home_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when the actor's home lot is the destination lot. Tokens: 0:ActorSim Example: 'Go Home'

Tunable.name: no_one_home_encapsulation
Tunable.description: The string that gets appended on the end of our interaction string if none of the household Sims at the destination lot are home. Tokens: 0:Interaction Name Example: '{0.String} (No One At Home)'

Tunable.name: ring_doorbell_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when the actor doesn't know any Sims that live on the destination lot. Tokens: 0:ActorSim Example: 'Ring Doorbell'

Tunable.name: visit_household_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when the actor knows more than one Sim that lives on the destination lot, or the Sim they know is not at home. Tokens: 0:ActorSim, 1:Household Name Example: 'Visit The {1.String} Household'

Tunable.name: visit_sim_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when the actor knows exactly one Sim that lives on the destination lot. Tokens: 0:ActorSim, 1:Sim known Example: 'Visit {1.SimName}'

Tunable.name: visit_the_household_plural_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when the actor knows more than one Sim that lives on the destination lot, or the Sim they know is not at home, and everyone who lives there has the same household name as their last name. Tokens: 0:ActorSim, 1:Household Name Example: 'Visit The {1.String|enHouseholdNamePlural}'

TunableTuple.name: visit_venue
TunableTuple.description: The interaction name for when the destination lot is a commercial venue and the actor is traveling with someone. Example: 'Visit The Bar With...'

Tunable.name: visit_venue_name
Tunable.description: The interaction name for when the actor visit this venue Tokens: 0:ActorSim

TunableVariant.name: variable_venues
TunableVariant.description: Enable for variable venues, where the venue can change automatically. Either this venue or one of the provided sub-venues can be the active venue type. Most venues do not enable this feature.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Variable venue tuning.

TunableTuple.name: civic_policy
TunableTuple.description: Tuning to control the civic policy voting and enactment process for a venue.

TunableList.name: civic_policies
TunableList.description: The civic policies that may be enacted.

Tunable.description: A civic policy.

TunableVariant.name: community_board_dialog_title
TunableVariant.description: The Community Board Dialog's title text.

TunableTuple.name: concatenation
TunableTuple.description: A list of localized string concatenations. These strings will be joined together into single line-separated string

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: single
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableTuple.name: variation
TunableTuple.description: A list of possible localized string variations.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TdescFragTag.name: daily_random_vote_test
TdescFragTag.description: If at least one test passes, and the user option is enabled, daily random voting will be performed at midnight.

TdescFragTag.name: initial_vote_test
TdescFragTag.description: If at least one test passes, and the user option is enabled, initial voting will be performed when voting opens.

TunableList.name: voting_close_loot
TunableList.description: Loot applied to Resident Sims when voting opens.

Tunable.description: Loot to apply on voting open.

TunableList.name: voting_open_loot
TunableList.description: Loot applied to Resident Sims when voting opens.

Tunable.description: Loot to apply on voting open.

Tunable.name: enable_civic_policy_support
Tunable.description: Whether or not Civic policies will control which venue is active.

Tunable.name: variable_venue_description
Tunable.description: Alternative description used when the parent venue is the active venue. Replaces Venue Description.

Tunable.name: variable_venue_display_name
Tunable.description: Alternative name used when the parent venue is the active venue. Replaces Display Name.

TunableList.name: venue_buffs
TunableList.description: A list of buffs that are added on Sims while they are instanced in this venue.

TunableTuple.description: A buff that exists on Sims while they are instanced in this venue.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

Tunable.name: venue_description
Tunable.description: Description of Venue that will be displayed

TunableList.name: venue_flags
TunableList.description: Venue flags used to mark a venue with specific properties.

Tunable.name: venue_icon
Tunable.description: Venue Icon for UI

TunableEnum.name: venue_requires_front_door
TunableEnum.description: Set to NEVER if this venue should never run the front door generation code. Set to ALWAYS if this venue should always run the front door generation code (like Residential lots). Set to OWNED_OR_RENTED if it should only run if the lot is owned by a household or rented by one. If it runs, venue will have the ring doorbell interaction and additional behavior like backup logic for broom teleports.

Tunable.name: venue_thumbnail
Tunable.description: Image of Venue that will be displayed

TunableList.name: venue_tiers
TunableList.description: A list of requirements where each requirement corresponds to a tier that will be shown in the buildbuy tier UI. Tiers should be tuned in order from worst (tier n) to best (tier 1), where worst is the element of this list.

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: If tuned, an icon to associate with this requirement in the UI. Currently only supported for venue tier requirements.

TunableTuple.name: required_object
TunableTuple.description: Specify object tag(s) that must be on this venue. Allows you to group objects, i.e. weight bench, treadmill, and basketball goals are tagged as 'exercise objects.' This is not the same as automatic objects tuning. Please read comments for both the fields.

Tunable.name: is_optional
Tunable.description: If True, this object requirement will be optional to this venue. E.g. Waiter station and host station for restaurant should set this entry to True.

Tunable.name: is_unit_specific
Tunable.description: If True, this object requirement will be specific to individual units of a multi unit venue.

Tunable.name: max_number
Tunable.description: The upper bound below which the number of objects of this type on the lot must be.

Tunable.name: min_number
Tunable.description: The lower bound above which the number of objects of this type on the lot must be.

TunableTuple.name: object
TunableTuple.description: Specify object tag(s) that must be on this venue. Allows you to group objects, i.e. weight bench, treadmill, and basketball goals are tagged as 'exercise objects.'

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tags of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: object_display_name
Tunable.description: Name that will be displayed for the object(s)

TunableEnum.name: object_flags
TunableEnum.description: Optional flags for this venue object. E.g. When there is a small business registered in that lot.

TunableList.name: object_parent_pair_tests
TunableList.description: Specify object tag(s) and/or parent attachment tags that requires to be on this venue. Allows you to group objects, i.e. weight bench, treadmill, and basketball goals are tagged as 'exercise objects.'

Tunable.name: count
Tunable.description: How many required objects will be satisfied with this object(and/or with parent pair). E.g. a chair that slots to table will count as one dining spot, but booth slot to table will count as 2.

TunableTuple.name: object_tags
TunableTuple.description: The objects (tag) that would count for the required items.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tags of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableTuple.name: parent_tags
TunableTuple.description: If set, the object tuned in object_tags would required to be slotted to the parent object tuned in parent_tags. E.g. in restaurant, a chair (with restaurant_chair tag) would need to slot to a table (with restaurant_table_tag) to count as a dining slot. But since bar will not has the restaurant_table_tag, so a high chair that slots to the bar will not count as dining spot.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tags of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableEnum.name: object_test_type
TunableEnum.description: This option determines what test will be applied. To test the number of objects of a certain type, select OBJECT. To test for a pool, select pool. To test the number of tiles used by the home, select tile (tiny home venues do this).

Tunable.name: tooltip_override
Tunable.description: If tuned, the tooltip that will be shown when this requirement is moused over in the venue configuration requirements UI.

TunableEnum.name: tier_banner_state
TunableEnum.description: The state to set on the tier banner in the UI if this requirement is the current active tier requirement.

Tunable.name: tier_banner_text
Tunable.description: If tuned, text which will be displayed on the tier banner if this requirement is the current active tier requirement.

Tunable.name: tier_name
Tunable.description: If tuned, the name of this tier. This will be used in places where we want to display a tier, but will not be used in the requirements panel (that will still be object_display_name).

Tunable.name: tier_name_two_lines
Tunable.description: If tuned, the name of this tier. This will be used in places like the tier cell view where we need to format the tier name as Tier x Tier Name.

TunableList.name: zone_modifiers
TunableList.description: A set of zone modifiers to apply if this requirement is met. These zone modifiers will be 'hidden' from the UI and will not appear as lot traits in the lot trait molecule or manage worlds.

TunableEnum.name: venue_type
TunableEnum.description: The venue's functional type. Used to distinguish venues that function differently.

TunableVariant.name: whim_set
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then this venue type will offer a whim set to the Sim when it is the active lot.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A whim set that is active when this venue is the active lot.

Tunable.name: zone_director
Tunable.description: The ZoneDirector type to request for this Venue Type. This will be the default type for this Venue Type. It may be overridden by a system such as Active Careers (e.g. your house is a crime scene now).

TunableVariant.name: zone_fixup
TunableVariant.description: Specify what to do with a non resident NPC when the zone has to be fixed up on load. This fix up will occur if sim time or the active household has changed since the zone was last saved.

TunableTuple.name: add_to_background_situation
TunableTuple.description: Add the sims to the venue's current background situation.

TunableTuple.name: create_situation
TunableTuple.description: Create a new situation of this type and add the NPC to its tuned job.

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: The situation job to assign the sim to. If set to None the sim will be assigned to the situation's default job.

TunableTuple.name: residential
TunableTuple.description: Specify what to do with a non resident NPC on a residential lot when the zone has to be fixed up on load. This fix up will occur if sim time or the active household has changed since the zone was last saved.

TunableTuple.name: npc_lot_greeted
TunableTuple.description: Create a new situation of this type and add the NPC to its tuned job.

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: The situation job to assign the sim to. If set to None the sim will be assigned to the situation's default job.

TunableTuple.name: npc_lot_ungreeted
TunableTuple.description: Create a new situation of this type and add the NPC to its tuned job.

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: The situation job to assign the sim to. If set to None the sim will be assigned to the situation's default job.

TunableTuple.name: player_lot_greeted
TunableTuple.description: Create a new situation of this type and add the NPC to its tuned job.

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: The situation job to assign the sim to. If set to None the sim will be assigned to the situation's default job.

TunableList.name: zone_modifiers
TunableList.description: A set of default zone modifiers to apply in this Venue Type. These zone modifiers will be 'hidden' from the UI and will not appear as lot traits in the lot trait molecule or manage worlds.
